Reviews.Title: “Beds are HARDER than rock.”
Reviews.Author: DS-Team
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are frequent visitors to Singapore and we had firmly decided that this time we were going for relaxation only, not trying to get to all the tourist spots, we were going to sleep in till whatever time everyday and then go and enjoy the food and sights Singapore has to offer at a leisurely pace, if that included an afternoon nap before then venturing out again for a lazy dinner then thats what we would do. Unfortunately this hotel appears to have purchased beds which are made of rock, or something harder if that is possible. After a room change and about 5 (not exaggerating, it might have even been 6 or 7) mattress toppers it was still no better. We were unable to sleep and got up at the crack of dawn most days. We even had to have massages as our backs were that sore. It is a real shame as otherwise the hotel was good and the staff were about as helpful as they could be, but our relaxing trip was ruined. In the first room we thought perhaps we had been given a room with a special bed for people with back problems by mistake, only on being shown several other rooms by the accommodating manager we realized that this was the 'normal' bed. I cannot stress enough how hard these beds were, and how much it ruined our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, good stay, slightly expensive”
Reviews.Author: Ru_Ma9Calcutta
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their website & had some problems with the online payment. The staff was very cooperative throughout. The reception staff was also helpful and allowed us to check in early. The room- nice enough, good view of the river. Beds were comfortable. Housekeeping was generally efficient, but they forgot to clean the room's garbage bin on two occasions (they cleaned the bathroom's, though). & I had to call them up everyday to ask for more black tea and sugar. Bathroom- Clean. Nice toiletries. Could do with better ventilation. & I'd prefer a mat on the floor in front of the bath tub rather than a towel- it used to get displaced all the time. Food at the hotel- Good, expensive as it would be in any hotel of that kind. We tried the Easter buffet- it was awesome. Breakfast is expensive if you don't book 'bed & breakfast' & there are no breakfast places around. You'll get your dinner & drinks across the river though. You just need to cross the bridge from your hotel's back entrance. On our 2nd morning, we breakfasted at Clarke Quay on our way to Sentosa & bought muffins & cakes from a Harbourfront shop for the other days. I advise trying the street stalls for other food- much cheaper but good food. Location- No MRT station. You'll need to take a bus to Clarke Quay for your Sentosa or Jurong trip. Problem is, while returning, you'll need to walk to the Boat Quay stop which is a bit far from the MRT station. You'll get buses for botanical garden & Little India in front of your hotel, for Orchard Road there's the hotel shuttle. If you are 3/4 people, take a cab for your trip to the zoo or the Flyer. It's actually cheaper & quicker. Nice walk by the river in the evenings. Overall, I liked my stay here, though I might choose somewhere closer to an MRT stn & somewhat cheaper next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing arrival, rest of stay better”
Reviews.Author: MeriM
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they were surprised to see 3 of us despite my note when booking online for an extra bed. Then we were given a twin share room, despite booking a deluxe queen room. After a few discussions with reception in which I declined staying in the room and going to a queen the next night, as well as declining a smoking room we were offered an upgrade to an executive room which we took. I am very pleased I didn't pay extra for an executive room as there is no difference. Unfortunately the beds are incredibly hard (and I like a firm mattress), the bathrooms are also tiny. The pool is a lovely space, but unfortunately on our second evening it was very dirty, there was a cover on the floor of the pool that had moved and the spa stunk like something had died inthe pipes. The Riverside restaurant is lovely and reasonably priced, though if you are ordering ala carte don't expect your meals to arrive at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked through Trail Finders and there was a slight problem with that, but all solved quickly and we were given a room on the Eighteenth floor. Good sized and comfortable room, good views of the river. Staff courteous and helpful.Easy walk of about twenty minutes to China Town ( if you don't mind the heat) with very cheap eating and some lovely street markets and Malls. Nice walks along the river ( which is actually a reservoir) Plenty of eating places, the hotels own patio on the river bank is very pleasant. Down side, no free WIFI, we had to pay extra for breakfast but it is 'buffet style' with a big variety and eat as much as you want. Jade Lounge drinks tend to be a bit pricey (but two for one in the Happy Hour) but service and entertainment good Never bothered with the TV so no comment.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of guest service”
Reviews.Author: ian j
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on Mar 8th. I knew this was no deluxe hotel so didn't expect much. Good location, good price. But I did expect my tv to work. Went out for dinner (around 8.00) and told front staff who assured me somebody would see to it. OK case close? No. Returned around midnight still not working. Rang front desk again and she suggested to send somebody up now, too late I said. Next morning went for an early walk and told front desk AGAIN. They said "maybe they forgot" Came back two hours later and guess what still broken tv. Upon check out staff could only muster sorry! The most basic amentity was not available. When I said to the front "Would you pay $200 for a room without tv"? He said "no I wouldn"t. So why should I? Guest Service, more like Pest Service. I am a hotel training manager by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Jade Lounge”
Reviews.Author: Hearty-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I am not reviewing the hotel or its rooms, but the Jade Lounge which is located at its ground floor. This is an interesting place. Why do I say so? The lounge is not that big, however it is entertaining. I have been there a number of times and thoroughly enjoyed the performance of the three ladies - the Angel Girls - who put in lots of effort to put up a good show. Service wise is not bad either. It is definitely a place worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Noise at night”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateJim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights last month on way from UK to Oz having booked with Trailfinders and were reasonably happy with room which was adequate but a bit dated. Location was OK with a nice 20 minute walk along river bank to Clarke Quay rather than trying to go along Havelock Road. Also hotel is the home of Liverpool FC supporters club showing games live. Our problem was on the second night (Saturday)in the room above us which are "Executive" rooms someone was having a party which lasted all night. I tried to quiten them by hitting the walls to no avail and eventually phoned first and then went to reception about one in the morning in my pyjamas and returned with a security guard. He was going to ask them to quiten down but I got the impression that as they were in Executive rooms they were above the rules and his actions made little impact and we would not stay again. Tips-get taxi to and from airport which for 2 is cheaper than shuttle bus and much quicker. Try not to eat or drink on Clarke Quay waters edge as most places are a rip-off but excellent cheap food can be had in adjacent Malls such as the one below Novotel on Clarke Quay. Beer prices in Brewerz brew pub rocket in evenings so go early as most of the beers are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Small, smelly, old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TKiriP_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and were glad it was only the one. The rooms are old and ours smelled of stale cigarette smoke. The bathroom was tiny and awkward, water temperature hard to control. We did have a very helpful bell boy who ran down to the front desk to fix our room key-card as it didn't work properly. But whilst waiting we had to sit on old stained, stinky chairs. Won't be staying there again despite it's good location - 15minute walk to Clarke Quay, lots of cafes opposite too. The bar was good though, showed Super 15 Rugby and had a good happy hour special.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & nice room, delicious buffet dinner but no free Wifi.”
Reviews.Author: Arlzev R
Reviews.Content: I stayed here by chance when the my Jetstar flight arrived late in Singapore from Auckland. Due to that, I missed my connecting flight to Kuala Lumpur. Jetstar then arranged for all affected passengers to be placed in Riverview Hotel. By then, this was the 2nd time that Jetstar had arranged our accommodation due to the delays. I salute Jetstar for this cause I know Airasia would never had done the same. Anyway we arrived the hotel at about 930pm & the hotel had reserved buffet dinner for us & it was seriously sumptuous: salmon, steak etc...buffet style. Anytime better than the set meal i received in Jet Park Hotel, Auckland. The only bad thing here was a total lack of free Internet & the staff at reception seem rather 'less friendly' that I'd expected them to be. Overall it was a good comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location But Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: lokh
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in Riverview Hotel. It have a nice view over the river and close to a numbers of restaurant and cafes. Price wise is a bit high for a 4 stars hotel. Nothing to shout about for the room, it is quite simple and clean. Poor service for checking in and out. Receptionist is not friendly. Didn't not even point where is the lift to the room or explain which level the room is. Was given the keys and the receptionist straight went off to attend other things. Same goes to the restaurant (for breakfast). The waiter just ask for your room number and leave you standing there. You have to look for your own table. Breakfast spread is a common one. Hotel WIFI totally unstable and not dependable. Luckily I subscribe to international roaming access. Not a hotel that I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Poor attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: crakyl
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Riverview Hotel in March 2012 for business. The location is very good and close to a myriad of restaurants and cafes, just over the bridge from the Hotel. We ate at the Hotel only once and found it expensive, combined with poor service. The other area of concern was the lack of free WIFI available in the lobby - or anywhere. The majority of the Cafe's in the vicinity of the Hotel beside the river had a wider selection of food, at more reasonable prices, while providing free WIFI. The two rooms we booked were upgraded to a "deluxe room". Unfortunately these rooms were extremely poor in condition and mould was found in the bathrooms. We wondered about the standard rooms as both the rooms we booked were in a poor condition. Overall, a very standard hotel that boasts a good position for the river and the associated cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: PPaddar
Reviews.Content: First trip of my sis and me to Singapore. Great service by the hotel, we reached there at about 10am on the 18 of Feb while the check in was after 2pm. The receptionist Jane was quite understanding and asked to relax in the lobby whilst she arranged for the room to be cleaned so we could check in early. True to her word at around 12pm we were given a complimentary early check in. Overall the room was spic and span, prompt room service. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but poor service”
Reviews.Author: Thiagarajan S
Reviews.Content: My staying period started from 27/Feb/2012 and will checkout on 2/March/2012. I am regretting for choosing this hotel for my business trip. The only plus point is the location whereas everything else, they loose the competition with any hotel (3* and below) in Malaysia. I am paying SGD 190++ which will come to about MYR 500 /night (corporate rate - Normal rate is SGD 450 /night = MYR 1080). With this price, what they are offering is lousy TV service and no complimentary internet access. SGD 16 for 5 hours usage. Total rip off. Average 3* hotel in Malaysia which will cost you about SGD 50 /night provide free internet access for the guest. In addition to that, the staff is not friendly and look to us like we owe them something. I am not sure how Singapore's slogan "Courtesy is our way" is taking place over here. I think Hotel 81 better as they give free internet access for SGD 100/night stay. What a 'cheap' hotel. A BIG NO to River View Hotel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at nice location”
Reviews.Author: ravi277
Reviews.Content: Had the opportunity of staying at this hotel for 3 nights in 2nd week of feb with 2 other couples. The hotel is located not far from Clarke Quay with its back facing the river flowing through the city which becomes lively & vibrant after sunset. Sipping beer sitting out there is real fun in the cool evening breeze. We had fairsized deluxe rooms having all amenities except for wi-fi facilities which is a bit expensive option at about 27 dollars for 24 hrs. Breakfast buffet has a nice lay out with impressive spread. Staff is polite and take good care of guests but as is mostly in Singapore, they hardly smile. Overall, a nice place to stay in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Helle T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 4 nights. The location is very good, but still affordable. Within walking distance of the Boat Quay, Clark Quay etc. Eventhough we brought our own car, we used of the many 'hop on/off' buses - which can be boarded from across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: hils r
Reviews.Content: Staff are very polite and helpful - a plus when staying here. The minus - really poor housekeeping. A very dusty bedroom and an extremely smelly bathroom indicated deep cleaning is required on a regular basis. Simple things such as changing the shower curtain and removing stoppers in sink and bath to disinfect/remove sludge buildup that accumulates from shampoo etc. should be standard between guests. Needed to ask for the bathroom to be disinfected, shower curtain to be changed - this was done, sadly should not have had to ask. Providing guests with a smaller better quality breakfast would have been more enjoyable than the low grade wide variety available.

Reviews.Title: “Okee, little extra”
Reviews.Author: An J
Reviews.Content: The fotos look better than the hotel actually is. The rooms are clean, but nothing special. This is a serviceable hotel, but dont expect extras. Busstop just 2 min walk. Beautiful location along the river! Absolutely go for a swim at night in the open air hotelpool, the experience makes the stay beautiful. Only downside: at night the watchman goes with you to the pool..... Good location for walks, restaurants and little shops all around.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tim”
Reviews.Author: alisonleahy
Reviews.Content: My brother in law who lives in Singapore booked us in here as it was good value by Singapore standards. We had a comfortably and quiet time for the four nights we stayed - nothing to give feedback about. It is a bit of a walk from the nearest MRT but the taxi pick up service outside is very efficient and you can walk to the central financial district along the river in 30 mins. It really is by the river and it is a pretty walk.

Reviews.Title: “An air mattress and tent would have been a better option”
Reviews.Author: TaxiCat86
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel as there was a conference on in Singapore and this was the only hotel available and its easy to see why. The location is inaccessible except by taxi and its not close to any shopping centres or train stations. admitedly it is a nice walk by the river to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay (major nightlift spots). The room itself was very basic, nothing flashy. the toilet was tiny and the television didn't work. sitting on the bed hurt my tailbone and sleeping on it was worse! I never knew they manufacture mattresses that hard! when I asked for an overlay to soften it somewhat, the overlay was harder than the mattress itself! the pillows on the other hand were lumpy and too soft. to make matters worse, there were little insects in the room. all in all a tired hotel that has not put in any effort to make their customers have a comfy stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beige”
Reviews.Author: Anna N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located quite well, near Robinson and Clarke Quay, but it lacks some personallity. The rooms are quite tired and even though I was on the 'executive' floor, the rooms were on the small side. The decor is 'beige' and it just dont feel welcoming or homley. As I was on a business trip I was hoping for a good network access, but being at the end of a corridor, the wireless that kept getting disconnected probably due to distantance to the access point and the load (there was a big conference going on). There is nothing really wrong with this hotel, just nothing really right either.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: littlecoldkiwi
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel but a bit out of the way to walk to orchard road or other amenities. The views are amazing but the pool is freezing!! Good value tho as much cheaper than other Singapore hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel at affordable rates close to Clarke Quay”
Reviews.Author: Swati2k11
Reviews.Content: The Riverview is a nice hotel about a 15 min walk from Clarke Quay. Luckily for us, we got a room on the 14th floor facing the river which provided an extra ordinary view. The hotel has got a nice old eastern feel to it. Rooms are not as plush as you would expect but are nice and tidy, specially the bathrooms.Food is primarily eastern in nature so for those looking for italian, continental or other cuisines need to venture elsewhere. A walk from Clarke Quay to the hotel in the night along the river is a must. Pluses: Walking distance from Clarke Quay, buses outside the hotel take you to MRT stations, affordable, clean Minuses: Food options are limited, Staff can have English issues, breakfast not very sumptuous

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...Not as nice as I expected based on price.”
Reviews.Author: JasonWilley
Reviews.Content: No free wifi and over priced food. I wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Unathorised credit card charges - Mouldy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: TomWesternAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from the 27 - 31/12/11. Booked two adjoining rooms. Initial allocation on 14 th floor provided us with rooms that overwhelmed us with the smell of damp mould. Pillows in the cupboard were damp to the feel. Both rooms the same. We requested a new allocation because there was no double bed - only two singles for my wife and I. Kids had 3 singles OK. New rooms on the 21st floor, were smoking rooms but we accepted because the smell of smoke is better than the smell of mould. Rooms generally clean but bathrooms mouldly. Rooms very small, probably 3.5 square meters in total. We arrived home today and found a $290.00 credit card deduction. We didnt use any mini bar or any food etc. We then rang the hotel and they told us the amont ($250 S%) was a deposit that would be refunded in 2 weeks. We are puzzled by this and will stop the transaction with Mastercard at the earliest opportunity. Be wary of this place, is it low class and there must be better options.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place!”
Reviews.Author: divyachaturvedi
Reviews.Content: What can i say! of all the hotels i have ever stayed in, i have never experienced such horrible rooms or indifferent attitude in service! Caution for those booking online- please check carefully or maybe cross check by calling the hotel before booking because what you see may not be what you get! the beds creek so much that god save you if you have been given a double bed coz if the person next to you so much as breathes, the entire bed shakes as if there is an earthquake! The staff is apathetic. They are not rude, just couldn't care less about your being or not being there. Maybe their attitude can be appreciated better by those travelling for business and not pleasure. The location is not so bad. It is not too far from any of the tourist attractions and it is easy to get transport of your choice to and from the hotel to anywhere in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, older hotel not in main tourist area, amazing cakes!!!”
Reviews.Author: daveevans22
Reviews.Content: Rooms comfortable, beds OK, all the amenities you'd expect but this hotel has seen better days. We stayed here on a Singapore Stopover with Singapore Air (great value), food was very good, but as with all hotels alcoholo prices are VERY high. Watch prices as you will often need to add a compulsory service charge and GST - look for the ++ symbols next to the prices. Singapore is a great place thought, the people are friendly, English appears to be the official language and the airport terminals at Changi are full of interesting things to see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great position”
Reviews.Author: IluvHollyDays
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the River View - it was an easy walk to Clarke Quay which was a great place to spend an evening. We didn't eat in the hotel but found reasonable snack bars close by for breakfast. Other reviews say it wasn't central but we didn't find it difficult to walk into the centre along the river bank. The room was pleasant and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Sam”
Reviews.Author: sam1981_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel's in Singapore are expensive these days. However, the Riverview Hotel is good value for money. t's not in a very central location but they operate a free shuttle bus every hour and taxis and buses are easily available too

Reviews.Title: “Money talks in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sam_878787
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during our Asia Stopover. Expensive hotel to stay in, but compared to the rest of Singapore it was very reasonably priced. Its your standard 1980's hotel which hasn't kept up with the times so probably drops a star or two every 20 years. Rooms were small but tidy, not much in the way of a minibar. Nice pool and gym and the buffet was excellent, best we have encountered. But try and book a package that gets you free breakfast as it cost us $30 SD each for breakfast!!!! A couple of decent restaurants and bars on the premises, not great food, but good for watching sport. The English isn't fantastic on the people around the concierge so don't expect any good answers to your questions. Location is decent for Singapore, easy to get around so it doesn't matter too much where you stay in the city. About a 20 min walk into the heart of the city and 10-15 min walk to the nearest Subway/Underground Train. At the end of the day it's Singapore. The city is totally overpriced and come 3 days you are totally over it and it's time to move on to the rest of Asia. Hotel wise and generally wise expect to pay a bit more and you have to realise you are not going to get the bang for your buck as you would in other destinations. And the tip of the day, if you see tons of hot chinese girls walking into a building across the road on the right which looks like a massive vegas casino, its not a casino and they are all prostitutes who don't speak english and want to find a millionaire singapore businessman!! As the cab driver said, "your'e in Singapore, Money Talks!"

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Travelwise400
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to Singapore and up to now I have been impressed with the hotels we've stayed in. Staff at reception were freindly and welcoming if not very experienced. Our room at the River View was supposed to be superior but I don't know what it was superior to. The room was small and the door opened straight on to the corridor, no entrance area into the room which is common nowdays and reduces the noise from the movements of other guests. The room had not been properly cleaned after the last occupants, there were 2 jelly sweets on the floor beside the bed. The showerhead holder was broken causing it to slide down the bar, (probably not an issue if you are less that 4 foot tall) otherwise not acceptable. The grout/seal around the soap holder at the bath looked very unclean. The bed was very firm as were the pillows. We recieved a wake up call at 7.30 that was not requested or set by us. The ironing board provided was a major health and safety risk because it was prone to collapse. The decor in the room was very drab, ok if you like various shades of brown, but would definately benefit from a make over. We had a late checkout arranged but while out of the hotel during the day our key card was cancelled and had to be recoded to enable us to access the elevators to our room. Too many failings for a supposedly 4 star hotel and thus over priced!

Reviews.Title: “Simply great”
Reviews.Author: ppkapoor
Reviews.Content: The River view hotel in singapore was our saviour. I was accompanying my partner on a business trip and we were meant to get a hotel room within a certain budget. His company put us up in what i can only begin to describe as a dump! River view was just a close walk away and the people were so nice. I walked into the hotel and explained my predicament to them. Even though they were almost at complete capacity they were able to find an empty room and share their prices. When i expressed that it was going beyond my budget, they suggested that i o online and book there as they were having a special online offer - which was perfect as it totally fit within our budget! They even managed to get us a room with internet connectivity, although it was terrible. they did however have wi fi in their common areas so we were able to get some work done at their bar which is by the river. The river is beautiful and serves as the perfect view from the outside bar. The drinks are not the best, but stick to regulars and classics and you should be ok. We also had a meal at their Japanese restaurant which was packed with locals, obviously indicating that it was a popular joint Again they were friendly and offered a few different Sake's to experiment with as i was had not had it earlier. A fun experience and the best value for money that i have seen any where in the world. I would go there time and again!

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: OzzieOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Superior room recently for a mini break and found that the hotel experience was more like a 3 star hotel although it promotes itself as a 4 star. The reality and the brochure don't quite match up. The establishment lacks the polish of a true 4 star hotel. The room was spacious. However, the room fittings and furnishings looked tired and could do with a revamp. eg: chipped wash basin, yellowed electric sockets, air conditioner was a little rickety, Nonetheless, the beds were comfortable and the linens were clean. Not the best place to stay if you prefer to get around on foot to the major tourist attractions as the location is best accessed by taxi, shuttle bus or commuter bus. However, the hotel participates in a limited shuttle bus program with the neighboring hotels for trips to Orchard Rd and Chinatown. All in all. Best summed up as serviceable, but could improve.

Reviews.Title: “Avg Stay”
Reviews.Author: madhurtodi
Reviews.Content: I had gone to singapore for the Formula 1 weekend in September 2011, along with my cousin. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and it was decent experience, although overpriced because of the formula 1 weekend. The location is ok, but any location in singapore is not more than 10-15 minutes away from each other. The check-in and check-out was a breeze, and the hotel gave us the room at 10am without any fuss about the official check-in time of 2pm, And allowed us to check out at 2pm instead of the usual 12noon. Room size was small and the bathroom was extremely small. It was a bit difficult to take a shower in the bath tub because of the small size, but was manageable. The staff did not clean our room after the first night, but were prompt enough to do so when we reminded them. Did not eat a single meal at the hotel and hence cannot comment on the restaurants and food at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing extraordinary... except the riverside community”
Reviews.Author: DecoDoppler
Reviews.Content: Booking a room anywhere in Singapore can be either expensive or a crap-shoot because of location. The River View is around average price for a mainstream property in Singapore proper, but the location makes it a better prospect than most. My room was billed "superior" and had a distinctive European feel about it. Not huge by any stretch but had a desk, enough storage space for one -- but would be tight for a couple -- a flat-screen TV with access to local and international stations, and a clean, pretty well appointed bathroom. Also an electric kettle and fridge. Very convenient for the business I was in town to conduct (cabs are reasonably priced and well-regulated), and really within walking distance of several must-sees including Orchard Street shopping area. The real kicker though is proximity to the river. The Singapore River is home to a number of small bistros, cafes, bars and snack bars. Short on "local" flavor but big on international appeal, a nighttime stroll along its banks is a fun way to spend time, and this hotel is right on the river on the inland end of this area and a few minutes from more than a dozen good spots to grab a glass of wine, a beer, or something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel”
Reviews.Author: vicky82wa
Reviews.Content: we stayed in may 2011 for 3nights family of 4. 2daults, 2toddlers junior suite very average hotel and rooms, nothing flash for such an expensive room very average, old furniture they forgot to set up the cot but quickly rectified it, westerners take note their cots are not of australian standards etc had to take taxi to all places like shopping centres casino etc overall an average hotel but next time i would stay closer to the shopping / casino areas

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with great surroundings”
Reviews.Author: PuneSekar
Reviews.Content: I stayed in River view Hotel for three nights in september. Check in was smooth and the ambience is pretty good. some rooms are smaller than others. so when you check in, see that you are not given in corner rooms. (13 to 17). Rooms are clean. For Indian travellers, please do not expect good TV channels. No freebies. not even water is available. Please buy from outside in case you wish to have drinking water. Breakfast was good though the restaurant was pretty crowded even at 7 AM.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fincati
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in River View Hotel. I wasn't expecting a lot from the hotel so the expectations were met.. Room was clean and average size. Maybe not a 4* star hotel but considering the prices in Singapore the Hotel was worth of staying. The nearest MRT was a bit far (15 minutes walk) otherwise the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel for a few nights stay”
Reviews.Author: jeremy0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our short trip to singapore during the great singapore sale. Arrived at 3pm but room was not ready. The hotel seems to be overbooked for weekends due to the many gloomy faces waiting for their rooms before us. Since we were driving, we left our bags at the concierge and came back at 7pm. Rooms were quite dated but still clean and functional. As everyone else mentioned, room was a bit musky and the bed was rock hard and a bit small in size. The other grouse was that the toilet emitted some sewer stench at night. Other than that, its a nice hotel with a good location for people with their own cars. It offers free parking and if u prefer public transport, the bus stop is just outside the hotel. It is a close drive to orchard road, clarke quay and sentosa island.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Experience - Amenities are good, staff is pathetic”
Reviews.Author: dayle s
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not bad structurally and in terms of amenities. They have a great pool, very convenient location, good restaurant and the room, tv minibar etc were all perfect. The service is where they get knocked down, firstly the staff are un interested upon check in they told me they needed to swipe my card just for verification and that they were not blocking any amount – upon checkout I realise they had blocked S$200 on my card without my permission. It gets worse, their phones in each room has a note to make international calls dial **111 followed by credit card number – I checked with the hotel staff about this facility and its costs, they told me I would be charged S$1.27 per min, so I made 4 calls that lasted around 2-3 mins each expecting my card to be charged around S$20. When I accessed my email a day later and saw the email alerts my bank had sent me I skipped a heart beat – I was charged around US$ 215 in total to some company called BBG Luxemburg – when I questioned the hotel they claimed they had no tie up with them but then they got me on the phone with BBG and I am still disputing the charges and waiting for a refund. I had to block the only card I was carrying due to this and it caused a lot of trouble. The hotel staff head Bernard and Ram Li was least interested in fixing things. So I have sworn never to come back here again and to never use a credit card in a hotel room irrespective of what is printed or told to me. During my stay I was out of the hotel through all the days I was living there and used to return close to midnight, when I requested for a jug of water they told me to drink off the tap as it was safe – I thought this was the most inappropriate response even if the water was safe to drink. I did not bother calling room service after this.

Reviews.Title: “Beaten by Insect”
Reviews.Author: D L
Reviews.Content: We were forced to stay in Singapore due to the volcanic ashes event. My baby and I were beaten by insect while staying in this hotel and end up having to seek medical attention upon returning to NZ. Don't bother making any complain because any symptom appearing after checking out is of their concern. By the way, this is a hotel where smoking in the lift is a norm and smoking floors are aplenty.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: d0gtail
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this hotel on tripadvisor before I went for my trip. It was too late to change hotels as I have already made payments for a 3 night stay. The hotel's location is rather far away from the city centre. There is a bus stand right in front of the hotel. The bus that will take you to the nearest MRT (near Clarke Quay) is bus number 52 or 59 (I can't quite remember because I never took it). Otherwise, if you don't mind hopping onto a cab,it's easily arranged. A walk down the river to Clarke Quay takes about 20 minutes. The food in the restaurant is average. There are some nice bars behind the hotel by the river. All you have to do is get out of the hotel's restaurant from the back and cross the bridge. In the mornings and evenings, you can also jog along the river bank. The front desk reception is not extremely friendly but neither were they rude. There were some whom could not really understand English, which I find quite embarassing for such an establishment. (the rooms are not cheap!) The hotel pool was clean however the jacuzzi was out of order throughout my stay! That was really disappointing. As previous reviewers have pointed out, these facilities are located on a smoking floor so as you enter you will find yourself greated by a musty, cigarette smell. The gym, which is next to the pool is rather small as well. I didn't have any problems with ants in my room. the room was quite clean. The biggest disappointment is the internet service which has to be paid seperately. It's quite abominable that internet service is not free after paying such an amount for the hotel room. To summarize, I will not stay in this hotel if possible because: It is far away from the city centre and MRTs It is not worth it for the price we are paying There is no free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location and view”
Reviews.Author: FromLitteRedDot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, the ambiance and the location is very good. Very accessible to city. If you don't want to ride a taxi because of high rate, you can take a bus which is just in front of the hotel. The bus services can lead you to Cityhall, where in you can take MRT, or just shop in funan digital mall or in raffles city. You can also take the bus and go to Clarke Quay, where the nightlife, dine-ins and views can be found. The price is not also that bad for this kind of hotel because of the cleanliness, and secured. Service is not bad either, staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “River View Hotel singapore”
Reviews.Author: Dubtrips
Reviews.Content: Breakfast not great, and expensive internet charges

Reviews.Title: “Great, safe location if you are traveling on your own”
Reviews.Author: Bluebrad
Reviews.Content: I had a two night stop over in Singapore before I went to Australia. Hotel is in a great location on the River. Its a 10/15 min straight walk into the tourist centre. I was on my own and it is very easy to get around Singapore. Hotel was expensive though and the receiption staff were not helpful at all. Hotel was very clean and safe. Dont eat there as it is very expensive. Just walk into town or get a taxi/bus

Reviews.Title: “Mix Feelings”
Reviews.Author: Jeyne
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feeling booking into this hotel after reading the reviews. Ok for 1) It is not near the MRT line, you have to walk a good 10 minutes to Clarke Quay @ Central. 2) The breakfast is just about ok, nothing to shout about. 3) The room given was a city view on the smoking floor (i am not smoker but they were fully booked!) so there was a odor..that was not nice 3) Entertainment at the hotel sucked, the band needs a revamp 4) The carpet has a mossy smell, needs a proper washing. Overall it was ok since we didnt mind the distance to walk and a good exercise for me! The other entertainment spots at Clarke Quay were amazing, so plus point for this hotel, its close to that place. Walk along the river and wallah u are at RiverSide and Clarke Quay. That was good.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice but not good for veg food”
Reviews.Author: Marinerprvn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 22nd july 2001.the hotel is Good for the lunch and dinner does not have any options for vegetarian food so was uncomfortable with the food. For Continental food wise it is good. Will prefer staying next time. The Internet and T.V service are chargeable which should be compliment.

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Tourist-Grade Place To Hang Your Hat”
Reviews.Author: hwy401
Reviews.Content: A bit spartan, but very clean. Apparently there's a river view, but I'm on the wrong side to enjoy it. There is an unfortunate funky smell when you enter the hotel lobby. There's a huge pillar by the check-in desk that impedes lining up to be served. Odd design. The hallways are perfumed and a bit thick with humidity. However, the room is deliciously air-conditioned. The bathroom has a mildly unpleasant sewer odor. The bathroom floor has a drain, presumably for overly exuberant showerers; this may be the cause, or, it might be the toilet. There was a notice about ignoring ongoing fumigation efforts, which was a bit alarming, but, with the exception of a single tiny ant in the bathroom (which I quickly dispatched), I had no problems. The buffet features the usual western and asian suspects. If you're a risk-taker, try the "Beef Buger" (which turns out to be nothing more than a small beef patty). The staff are not all proficient with English. I complained that there was no Kleenex in my room, and the gal seemed quite alarmed. She passed me off to a guy, who asked me, "what's that?". I explained and he said, "oh, the box!". So, I agreed, and he said he would send one up, along with toilet paper which also had not been replenished. When I got back from the breakfast buffet, I checked and there was still no Kleenex or toilet paper refill, but, the TV was on. So, at least they are trying. Actually, it's kind of funny. You have to have a sense of humour about these things. Singapore is a great city and this is a decent tourist-grade place to hang your hat, so don't let any minor deficiencies in this place spoil your stay. If you like Indian food, get yourself down to Little India. You might see me hanging out along Race Course Road, savouring the Butter Chicken and Naan bread.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheper3625
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here due to Fuji web sid f up my stay in Singapore day have to say it was one of the worst stays on my trip . Room smelled moldy, or dead body Capet have to go .... had ants and both bathroom and bed . try to rip off traveler...... bad company total charge 1 day %$500.00 usd

Reviews.Title: “Plain and not impressive”
Reviews.Author: BorodBorod
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good neighborhood, but neverthless it is about 20-25 minute walk to an MRT station. But if you like exploring everything on your feet, it is a nice and pleasant walk along the river to the city center. Other than that, a super plain place that could be in any other city and needs a clean-up and rennovation. Rooms are of a decent size, but quite dirty and definitely older. Front desk was not very nice, very slow - even by Asian standards - and not helpful at all. I booked this hotel several weeks in advance, and the reservation confirmed a queen bed. When we got there, they said (and the tone was everything but apologetic) that they are overbooked, queen room was not clean and was not going to be clean for at least 2 hours (the way they clean the rooms probably takes less than 5 minutes, so I am not quite sure what would take so long), they only had twin beds. When I asked if we could get a king instead, they said, we'd have to pay the difference. We very politely inquired if there is anything they can do for us to compensate for the inconvinience, they abruptly said there was nothing - not even free Internet. Not the worst experience, but I would never come back.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: Jivitesh
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in this hotel in April 2011 while i was in with my family tour. The rooms were small & conjusted, however the location was beautiful to have fun on the river side with beers. It is witin convenient range with almost all must visit places foe e.g Orchard road, Little india , Sentosa within 10 Singapore dollar. There are plenty of eating options just outside along the river side which provides fantastic food with a choice of good wines,

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: PippaRB
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights on our way back from Bali for a city break in Singapore. The staff were rude, unhelpful (when asked how long it was to get to the airport I received the reply "I don't know"). As per other reviews, there was a distinct funky smell in the reception, the carpets in the room were dirty, the beds lumpy. Room service was shoddy, they didn't put our clean glasses or clear away dirty ones. Location isn't great, although we did a lot of walking (it is hot!) and could walk to China Town in about 15-20 mins. We prefer to use public transport than taxis and were told the underground is complicated (it's not) and they didn't know of any buses that ran into town (I believe there were buses) and we didn't even know about the shuttle until we were leaving. On a brighter note, there are lots of restaurants across the bridge, keep walking down as they go much further than you first think. Internet is extortionate so a little tip, go to an aussie bar across the bridge and you get free wifi there.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but far from everything”
Reviews.Author: dimples1976
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel very last minute via Expedia. We chose this as it stated that the location was by the Singapore River which was the area we were aiming for. We stayed in Room 1427 Unfortunately, it was a little further away from everything. Clarke Quay was a 10 minute walk away. The closest amenity was a service station across the street via a walk-over bridge. However, the location is probably the worst thing about this hotel. On the flip side, it's a clean hotel. The decor is somewhat dated. We were only in Singapore for a couple of days whilst visiting friends so we didn't necessarily need to be close to all the nightlife at Clarke Quay but it would have been more convenient. I would say this is definitely a no frills hotel. Taxis were easily available outside the hotel, otherwise a 5 minute walk would get your to Robertson Quay and a further 5 minute walk would get you to Clarke Quay. If you wanted to get to Orchard Road then a cab would be the best option. The service was fine. Nothing special but then we had no special requests anyway. Personally, I would not book this hotel again purely because the location is not convenient. If I were to visit Singapore again and require a reasonably priced hotel I would probably go for the Novotel Clarke Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Mocsoft
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small, the bed is like a plank of wood with a sheet on top, Internet costs $25 per day which is extortionate and to top it off some of the staff are very rude.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, excellent facilities, but not average location”
Reviews.Author: zeebug
Reviews.Content: This hotel experience was very pleasant. Very friendly staff. The hotel was modern, very clean and tidy and the facilities were excellent. The room had a nice view of the river. There was a good sized pool, a great gym, sun lounges, a spa pool, and steam rooms. The hotels restaurant wasn't that great but there was a bridge right outside the jade lounge door which took you across the river, where there were plenty of bars, restaurants, and cafes. The hotel itself isn't in the greatest location as there are no malls nearby and no activities in walking distance. Would definitely recommend, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Crouching_Hippo
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews to this hotel before coming out here and they weren't great, so I wasn't sure what to expect. However when I arrived, the place, the staff and all the bad things people had said about the hotel weren't justified. I stayed here for 19 nights and had no problems at all. When I checked in, I wasn't happy with my room (twin instead of double) and they changed this immediately, hooked me up with complimentary broadband wireless and showed me the facilities. The staff were extremely helpful and attentive at all times. The breakfast, room service and restaurant menus were great with enough choice to satisfy any palate. Obviously there are places in Singapore where you can eat extremely cheaply if you know where to look. The location is fine as there is a bus stop directly outside the hotel and you can get a taxi easily enough too. All forms of transport are cheap (taxi from Changi to the hotel was $21.00 which would have cost the same in GBP were it the UK!) but walking is also good along the river down to Clarke Quay and Chinatown. Walk slowly, see the sights and try not to sweat too much! All in all, a lovely place to stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinerBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and beds are large and comfortable. A very clean hotel. Excellent breakfast. Location is perfect. It's on the river and so you simply follow the river walk through Robertson Quay, Clarke's Quay, Central and on to the Esplande and the waterfront. It's about a thirty minute walk and you can't get lost!!. Chinatown is on this route and we walked there at night from the hotel, had a meal and a walk around the area and then walked back around 11.30pm. A very safe place. Would also recommend the Botanical gardens for at least a morning. Very impressive

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: indonesia
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 5 nights in the Riverview and it was my 2nd stay here and I must say in the 7 years since i was last there it was even better than before ! The rooms are cosy, quiet, clean and big. The views are great , the location is not far from City Hall and all the other attractions. The pool is great and clean and very relaxing. The bar was expensive for drinks , but thats Singapore in general for alcohol. The receptionists and concierges were very helpful and you could always get a cab easily outside. Would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Thought Excellent place to stay for couple of days.”
Reviews.Author: LondonMermaiden
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to Thailand.Taken to our room but was'n't facing the River as expected! This was changed in minutes! GREAT! The furnishings maybe could be renewed, BUT! had very, very Good sleep. The Staff helped us with all our needs and found them very nice. Even the local tour people that sat in the Loby helped us with nothing that benifited them, hats off to them. The Hotel is mainly for people passing through Singapore on transi or on short breaks I would say. Loved the walk along River side to Clark Quay and then to Raffles.We also could walk to China Town (YES HOT) but see much more by walking. Used every form of transport, Bus, MRT,Taxi, very cheap but also lots of walking. The breakfast was good, as buffet style so help yourself, with PLENTY of cups of Tea! Singapore is very expensive compared to some Cities,but it is a City and prices always are higher. We took advantage of the Pool! that cooled us down in the afternoon,was great did'nt share it with anyone,Great just the two of us. We stayed here part of a package with our flights so feel it was very good value for us.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was in a superb situation, very clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: kenfrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River View on our way back from Australia and really enjoyed our time there. We had a river view and it was nice and peaceful. Our room was spacious and clean and the beds very comfortable. We ate in the 24 hour restaurant as my husband and I both have special diets and the staff were most helpful in providing us with food that we could both eat. We used the local buses and trains to get around but found that the taxis were cheaper! We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff were unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: Angelntinks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on the river, but not close to any metro station but good bus links. The staff were so rude and unhelpful. The buffet was not bad, if you like lots of fish and the a-la-carte had limited selection. The rooms were a good size and the hotel itself was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DwTokidoki
Reviews.Content: I normally take photos of hotels I visit but for this one I was too tired (from work) to take. So my apologies. A local from Singapore helped me booked this hotel for our business trip. Basically it wasnt a personal choice. In spite of that, the hotel is: 1. Good location from Orchard Road! It's approximately SGD 7-10 per cab ride. 2. The cab fare from the airport is approx SDG 30 3. It's near to the CBD - 10 mins drive 4. Hotel is clean. Rooms are spacious. The bathroom is also spacious. 5. Near the cubs/pus - walking distance 6. Nice river view from the room window. 7. The hotel has a free scheduled shuttle service to Orchard Road and to Chinatown. Ask the front desk for the sked. On the other hand, here are some down side: 1. Breakfast isnt that pleasant. 2. Hotel lobby smells "spicy". I think most hotel lobbies has this weird spicy scent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Location is a bit of a drag though”
Reviews.Author: anna_purton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in january. We stayed very high up and had amazing views. The Buffet breakfast was diappointing and very expensive. There was a large selection of food, but not good quality. The Chinese restaurant was good quality but not very good service. The location of the hotel was a bit disappointing, you had to catch a can pretty much everywhere, but cabs aren't too expensive and the concierge will organise one for you at reception so it's really quick and easy. The room was small but very nice and housekeeping did a really good job of keeping it clean. I would probably try a hotel closer to Clark quay next time, but it wasn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel charges $26+ per day for internet access !”
Reviews.Author: Aix17
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in average condition, away from the main business and shopping areas and a long walk (15 mins?) to the nearest MRT Clarke Quay. Most hotels in Singapore offer free internet but not River View so you need to take this into account when comparing prices. Consider internet charge, breakfast not included and more taxi costs due to location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, pity about the location”
Reviews.Author: Bozz56
Reviews.Content: Advertising of this hotel makes it sound like its so close to everything.Fact is its a bit out of the way and you need a taxi to get anywhere to get decent food or shopping.Hotel itself is neat & clean. We chose the river view room. Very quiet, no traffic noise. Internet cost seems excessive for this day and age. Smallish gym but had the basics. If you are looking for a quick stopover try to get something more central. If you are after peace and quiet, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Maeve2011
Reviews.Content: On arrival on attempting to check into our double no smoking room, we were told by a not so friendly receptionist we could have either a room with 2 single beds which was non-smoking or a double bed in a smoking room, she tried to persuade us to take either of these rooms and we would get our correct room the next day. On refusing to accept this arrangement several times, we were eventually given a double room. This service on arrival really disappointed us and left a bad taste in our mouths. The room was musty, dirty carpet and bathroom especially tiles and toilet fixtures required a good clean. could smell cigarette smoke in bathroom!! Maid service not great, bed never looked tidy. Rough around the edges. Improvements necessary. Pool lovely however located on a floor which reeked of cigarette smoke. Jacuzzi did not appear to be operating correctly, water not very warm. Food good in restaurant and service was good. Would not return to this hotel or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Average, OK FOR CHEAP STAY”
Reviews.Author: Pauline S
Reviews.Content: Returned today after spending a few days at the River View. Room good, however bedding terrible with sheets velcroed to the doona ?, Doona cover was washed but very stained, and the carpet so dirty you could have grown potatoes in it, mould in the bathroom and stains on the tiles.. On the good side we loved the location, with lovely evening walks along the river. it is pretty central to everythng, no more than 5 or 6 dollars by taxi to Vivo, Bugis st, China town etc, nice walk to Clark Quay. and we are old. OK for a cheaper Hotel, needs a good housekeeper to clean the joint up a bit. food good but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean but far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: GinoOdjick
Reviews.Content: Singapore is one of my favourite cities but I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel overlooking the river”
Reviews.Author: EsJayUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff gave us a very good deal on the room as we arrived in the city looking for a place to stay; not the thing to do as Singapore seems to have no vacancies most nights! The room was good, clean and spacious with great views of the city. The hotel has a gym, pool and spa overlooking the city which was good. Would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay the night”
Reviews.Author: JohnKorn
Reviews.Content: I had no complaints with the staff at the hotel, the hotel was not to bad and the hotel room was clean from what i could see. The only complaint with this hotel is its very far away from MRT ect and getting taxi's can be difficult depending on the time of day. the lobby turns into a train station at check out, which i guess happens in all hotels. I would only recommend this hotel to those who are only going to sleep in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hospitality and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Ashwaniship
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with wife and two young kids during peak of season time as such my stay was very comfortable the staff is quite co-operative and hotel is well equipped. Ambiance is pleasing and the River side view is Awesome. Menu Card has a lot of variety to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: Krongtong
Reviews.Content: The location is terrible as it is far away from MRT station. Room charges expensive but no good quality. The room was ok but needs more cleanliness. All staffs were not helpful. I booked for 2 deluxe rooms and 1 triple room but they tried to ask me to say yes for one suite room and one deluxe room instead but I said no because I paid for beds not the sofa bed in suite room then we found that the air-con in one room was not working so we ask for changing the room but they told that they could't do it because it was fully booking even thay just asked us for the suite room when we checked in. Anyyway they sent someone to fix it later. Another room had a smoking smell when we first went into the room. Not enough city maps for hotel guests which is quite important thing for tourists. The reason from staffs was fully booking again so no more maps for guests who came after. When i asked the housekeeping for an electric adapter, they gave me one into my room but it didn't work. All hotel staffs' face make guests think that they were not willing to solve a problem or give a good service even they are in a service industry.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to pay more attention to room cleanliness -staff friendly”
Reviews.Author: coledale62
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights in mid December after a 3 week stay in Thailand. We had booked the accommodation through a travel agent and were given a package that was to include a late 4 pm checkout on the last day - this was one of the main reasons we chose this particular hotel within this price range. (We had an 8.30pm flight to Sydney) We were also apparently supposed to be "upgraded " to a deluxe room and receive a buffet breakfast each morning. Check in was smooth and first impressions of the hotel were good - a simple austere lobby with efficient reception staff and attentive bellboys . Our room on the 6th floor (note that deluxe rooms as per the hotel website start from level 10) was disgraceful. The carpet had not been vacuumed , there was hair in the bath and on the bathroom floor, the toilet leaked and the air conditioner's control knob was missing and therefore couldn't be adjusted. The significant issue however was that the room (level 6), which looked directly onto the pool area smelled overwhelmingly of mold, which was growing on the bathroom ceiling and in the grouting around the bath. We had also been allocated a room on a smoking floor, despite our booking having been made with a non smoking room request. After one night the smell finally got to me and my husband requested a change of room, which the reception staff to their credit organized without fuss or delay. The second room was clean, on the 9th floor, but overlooked Haverlock Road, rather than the river. It had a clean and newer bathroom without mold or the accompanying smell, and our beds were comfortable, even the roll-away for my daughter. (Incidentally, we asked about the deluxe room and were assured that this room, on Level 9, was deluxe - this is not what the hotel website reports however) Breakfast was good with the food catering for visitors from all parts of the world - staff were both friendly and helpful. We enjoyed using the pool which has fabulous views over the river, and the free shuttle service into orchard road. The Hotel is right on the river and its an easy walk down the beautiful river front to china town, Clarke quay etc. The view along the river at night is awesome. Would I stay there again - no. Cleanliness for me is a major factor when I pay for a hotel room, but especially in a city like Singapore. A hotel in that price range which thinks that the level of cleanliness/maintenance we received in our first room is good enough to put guests into will not get my money again or my recommendation to other families.

Reviews.Title: “bad smell from bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Kainymann
Reviews.Content: the location for this hotel is good. near to restaurants og shopping mall. But I will not recommend this hotel. Me and my collegaues observe often ants at breakfast table. Food here is almost tasteless and coffe is awful. The rooms have ok view, but the bad smell from toilet is awful. There is only ventilation at bathroom 2 hours each day. Don`t every have a bath in yazzuci. It smells very bad and I dont think they use to clean it. We just live at this hotel because our company have a deal with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't understand the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: Scorpion3698
Reviews.Content: Firstly I'd like to respond the reviews. Firstly this hotel is about 1km from the MRT stations but so what. You are within walking distance of Chinatown, Clarke Quay, Raffles and Orchard Road. It is an ideally situated hotel. The taxis are as cheap as anywhere in the world and they come across the foyer of the hotel constantly so no need ot book. And about people drinking on the bridge, what a load of rubbish !!!! The bridge was never occupied other than people crossing it. It lights up at night and it was beautiful to sit outside the bar/restaurant and have a drink next to the river. The staff were very courteous and very helpful. I don't know if people want sunshine and roses or a little dance when they roll up to reception but they did their job, they did it well and I have no complaints. The rooms, they were a little small but I find they are in the far east. They were clean and to my expectations. The only negatives were the cost of the internet but again most far east hotels charge for it. Drinks cost a lot but they did everywhere in Singapore. I WILL use this hotel again when staying in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you are with kids and also if looking for easy connectivity”
Reviews.Author: KayJayCalcutta
Reviews.Content: River Valley is an old hotel, with a smelly lobby and though the room sizes are OK, the hotel has practically no connectivity in terms of public transport. The only saving grace of the hotel is the Riverwalk which connects you to Clark Quays. Do not pay more than 100 to 120 Singapore dollars for this hotel. Internet is expensive and so is the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “bad location and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Hami80
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at clarky. Its quite far from the bars and clubs. Its a good 15 min walk. In front of the hotel in the night you will find boys and girls drinking on the bridge, which is not safe if you plan to walk to the pubs. The hotel provides shuttle service but not to clarky. We had booked 2 nights and when we came back after the first night, the hotel receptionist informed us that we have been checked out. The service is very bad. The cost of the hotel and food is quite expensive. I would recommend to stay near the bars which is near robertson quay. The view of the hotel is good, we had a river view room. Taxi is easily available to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “MARVELLOUS”
Reviews.Author: swapnil_dikholkar
Reviews.Content: Date : 07Jan2010 I and my parents got the opportunity to stay in Hotel River View through our Travel Agent to whom we have booked our Tour. Before coming to Singapore itself, we had as idea of our stay in Hotel River View. So, i checked the reviews in Tripadvisor..... and we felt relaxed before our journey to Singapore... The hotel is situated on the River.... and we were so lucky to get the Hotel rooms facing the river.....!! You can enjoy the open river side view by sitting in your room itself. The hotel is very clean and posh.... Its entrance itself explains it.... where we can find a old monument of a ship..... Although, we didnt get much opportunity to taste the food, but we were regularly taking breakfast in the morning.... One thing i liked about their breakfast....is its timing..... As, people go out early in the morning to visit places, their breakfast is ready since early in the morning.... Overall, the hotel is superb ...!!1

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value”
Reviews.Author: cherylh124
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny, and the room carpet so old-looking, dirty and worn that you dare not touch it with bare feet. The first room had stains on the bedsheet and grime on the walls. We asked for larger rooms, and received "the best in the hotel" which was about 10' larger than the first. No stains on the bed and the walls were slightly cleaner in this room. Overall, this felt like a Motel 6. View out the window was great and internet worked well, but for $200 a night, there are nicer choices available in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Location is still OK but service not as good as our previous visit.”
Reviews.Author: FarEastTraveller33
Reviews.Content: Our second visit to this hotel and the service was not as good as we recalled. However, the riverside location remains good. We stayed for five nights in October and on this occasion we included breakfast – something we regretted in hindsight as the buffet selection was not great and the quality only average. The service by the staff in the restaurant is also poor but the service of other staff at the hotel we found to be both friendly and efficient. Far better to take a stroll along the river where one will find a selection of fine eateries. Room was fine and the views of the river were very good.

Reviews.Title: “It was amazing, fantastic, stuck my heart, location of the hotel and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Samik4
Reviews.Content: I selected the hotel through net. When wei reached to the hotel and saw the river,my heart was fulll of happiness, I was sitting till midnight in the chair and looking outside. The hotel was very clean with all necessary facilities inside the room. If I visit Singapore again I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the price”
Reviews.Author: casking
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for onlly one night. I purchased a room on expedia.ca which gave me a great deal, saved about $90 more than what the front desk was asking for. The location is good being close to Orchard area and Clarke Quay. There are also some more upper scale restaurants along the river close by. The room was average to below average. Really the hotel is just really outdated. The room looks like something you will see in a 70's movie. It was fairly clean though. the room service was slow, took about 20 mins for a bucket of ice to arrive. The food in the hotel buffet restaurant was really good but again it was rather expensive and the selection wasn't great. I wouldn't stay here again for the price. If it was closer to $100/night it woud be a more fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for the Rock Hard beds”
Reviews.Author: kj2421164
Reviews.Content: 1. Lousy tv with only 2 - 3 channels can be watched. others are either flickering or muted (un-tuneable). 2. Provide no toothbrush. you'd have to make the call 3. Very un-friendly front desk receptionists. I have no idea if that's a Singaporean Hotel Industry culture or anything, even Mandarin Orchard Hotel(5 stars) are having very un-friendly receptionists too. Maybe if you're blonde you'll be better treated. Depressing. 4. The beds are hard, and pillows are too soft to even carry the weight of your head. 5. Nothing much around the hotel. MRT station is far and you'd need to use the cab a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: sleepysteve
Reviews.Content: As Singapore turns itself into a tourist destination it appears that competition for hotel rooms is growing. This was an expensive hotel in terms of value for money. The size and quality of the rooms were standard for Singapore: clean, comfortable, with a slightly "institutional" feel to them. Room amenities were standard. Air conditioning was excellent which almost compensated for the fact that the windows can't be opened. Breakfast was mediocre. Didn't have other meals there as there are good restaurants a short walk away along the river. Location in terms of public transport is crap -- the nearest subway station is a very long hike. Fairly easy to get one of Singapore's abundant taxis (note: taxi pricing varies according to the type of car, the time of day, and destination so that a taxi ride that costs 15 Sing dollars at midday can cost 15 Sing dollars at rush hour.) I was there for business and so was outraged to find the hotel charges 25 Sing dollars a day for an internet connection (and a lousy connection at that).

Reviews.Title: “Lousy hotel with lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Lerred
Reviews.Content: I made my room reservation from the hotel's online portal from Friday to Sunday for my family. Initially i was happy that there was a promotion published on their website for Malaysian passport holders - "Weekend special: complimentary breakfast (up to a maximum of 2 breakfasts) for bookings on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays." However, upon checking-in I was told that my reservation was not entitled for the complimentary breakfast promotion. I tried to explain to them that this is published on their hotel website. However, upon checking, i was then informed that this promotion has ended. If you check out their website, the promotion is still showing: http://www.riverview.com.sg/promotion.php I believe the hotel should honour what has been published instead of making excuses. when we checked in, we realized that there was no toothbrush. I called for them to send up but i had to call another 2 times for them to send it up. In addition to this, the air con in the room was not functioning properly - it is not cold. Once agian, i had to call them 3 times before they send someone to "fix" the problem. The next night we had the same problem with the air con. again, it took some time for their maintenance man to come fix the problem. Later, he told me that the air con cannot be switched off as this was an old unit and once it is switched off, there will be a problem again! unbelievable! i will NEVER go back there again. we has a good trip to SG only downside was the attituted of this hotel staff and their poor service.

Reviews.Title: “A great view”
Reviews.Author: Rahul01
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very comfortable with great view from the room. Loved the river walk directly accesible from the hotel's restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased with the hospitality offered...”
Reviews.Author: devilzheir
Reviews.Content: this was my first time in Singapore.... my agent checked me into River view hotel for 1 night, next 2 nights were on the cruise and we were to come back for 2 more nights in the same hotel.... our cruise was at 7PM, n it slipped our mind that we had to check out at 12!! we approached the counter for check out at 5PM.... the manager was soo sweet, she agreed to let us off as we were to come back in another 2 days.... Ideally located hotel, bus stop in front of hotel... Can catch a bus for Orchard Road or Little India very easily....

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful managment”
Reviews.Author: claytonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Due to personal circumstances I ahd to cancel my booking. I did so several days beforehand at considerable cost in international phone bookings. The hotel failed to register the cancellation and has charged me the full fee. So now I have paid for the phone call, plus the booking. The hotel has had none of the costs of cleaning, linen etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for Business Travel, average one if you are with Family”
Reviews.Author: sb2502
Reviews.Content: My husband is a frequent user of this hotel and as a business user, he finds it extremly suitable for his needs. This we travelled to Singapore with with our one year old. The service at the hotel is nice, but the beds are not comfortable, especially if you are staying with kids. The breakfast was strictly business orinted , though they didn try to have one Indian dish. Overall good expereince, but would recommend it more for a business traveller than a family.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: sumeetjk
Reviews.Content: very nicely located near the river and in the city itself. the rooms are small but very nice and the food is also very good

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel will make your singapore trip a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sid_moghe
Reviews.Content: I had been to Singapore for my honeymoon during July 2009. The place is on Havelock road about 30 Mins drive from the Changi Airport and similar time from the Singapore port. The hotel in itself looks pretty ordinary from the outside, but its super good value for money from the inside. http://www.riverview.com.sg/index.php We were in the deluxe suite on 7th floor with direct view of the corpthorne kings and miramar hotel up front. The staff is very courteous and will make your room any number of times a day. The room in itself is pretty good with no problems what so ever. There are the following things that were already placed in the room 1. electronic locker 2. tea/coffee maker 3. water bottle 4. mini fridge 5. iron and table 6. ingredients of team and coffee It has 3 eateries in total - River Garden, Jade Lounge, River Palace The hotel has a very good coffee shop ( river Garden ) with a very good spread for all the 3 meals. I usually had a king size breakfast and the rest of the meals were spent on tasting street food around Singapore. The River garden is on the banks of the Singapore river and is pleasant all throughout. The food spread generally includes good amount of vegetarian/non-vegetarian continental breakfast charged at about 22SGD per person. The hotel also has a travel desk and a souvenir shop that can double as a local emergency shop. It does have a gym and a pool , but i never had the time to go there. All in all, the food is great, so is the hotel and its staff. Wifi is available for extra cost and the speed is pretty good. There is a local bus stop right in front of the hotel which is good for local transport. Clark quey is 10 mins walk from the hotel and has a lot of shopping and eating places around. The duckwater tours also start from there. If u havent been to Singapore, please do go and go to Riverview hotel- you will enjoy yourstay PS: the bath fittings from Kohler and Toto are insane if you like having leisurely soaks PS: the photos should match the opening picture on the webpage ( riverside is on the right side bottom )

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with average service”
Reviews.Author: Sharkyag
Reviews.Content: This hotel portrays an attitude and style, and makes a statement with its marble flooring and room layout. This experience was totally unique as this hotel's rooms were totally different from what I was used to. From a widescreen plasma attached to the wall to the unique furnishings, it was a treat to absorb the surroundings of the hotel. As the name suggests, this hotel rests beside the Singapore river. It is advisable to request for a room with a view of the river. We had a lot of pleasant nights after dinner we were able to take walks along the river. The rooms are very comfortable, and well insulated as the sounds of the bustling city are unable to penetrate the windows. The bathrooms are clean and good looking. There is a good TV in the room. There is even an electrnic safe for personal use. The breakfast buffet was average and good enough for consumption, but was not exceptional. Another thing that we did not like was the slow service. I would recommend this hotel for its view and location, but only for people who have come to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for stopover”
Reviews.Author: jerryAustralia
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stopover in Singapore and stayed here principally for its location. It was close to Clarke Quay / Boat Quay and within walking distance of Chinatown. The room was comfortable, clean and the service very efficient. My only gripe was the noise coming from the air conditioning or lifts which was constant and quite noisy. As a result, I didn't get a great night's sleep. Apart from that though I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “it was better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: DIAMANTINA
Reviews.Content: English is not my first lenguage like for the receptionist! I apoligize for any mistakes :-} We stayed at Riverview because we booked just 4 days before arriving: there wasn't much choice, lots were fully booked, if you are looking for quality and good price. Was our first little holiday without kids, so I asked for a nice room. When we arrived we checked in really early (we arrived at 6.30am we got the room before 9.30am!!) and we got a FREE upgrade! On the 17th floor the deluxe room was very spacious - bed not very large maybe between our double and queen size - and bathroom was also nice and very clean. - I forgot to tell you: the bed is firm....really firm! We used the pool a lot, also quite large. The spa was in a good position on the side of the pool on the 5th floor, unfortunately the jets didn't really work much and was a bit dirty. Location was good....if you like to walk to clarke quay (good 10-15 min walk but nice on the riverbank) or catch the bus (lots of buses and very frequent) A bit far from the metro. We changed our mind on breakfast - too expensive! Overall was good, very clean and quite. We had a pleasant stay.......we may go back again/.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, prices are not cheap”
Reviews.Author: GermanExpatHanoi
Reviews.Content: We chose this place for the easy distance to the National Eye Center, where I had surgery. We found the location perfect - Chinatown and Clarkes Quay in walking distance and a nice view over the river and the hotel skyline. The rooms are small, but not unpleasant, due to the big windows. Bath and bathtub us really small. Price for room seemed OK, but the addons are a ripp-off: Breakfast at 11 S$ is a joke, internet at 25 s$ per 24 hours is a scandal, if you know that there is free WiFi in Singapore available.

Reviews.Title: “Only because its cheap and available”
Reviews.Author: Dutch-Harry
