Reviews.Content: Outdated hotel on a nice location Pro's Cheap (for Singapore standards) Always rooms available Location Con's Truly badly trained/ unmotivated staff New package tourist will arrive every day Outdated hotel Smelly rooms Breakfast is below avarage Internet will be charged SGD 28 a day! No non smoking rooms Sauna not working (for long time already) Pool filled with to much chloroform Jacuzzi is simply dangerous Tip 1: Do not use the jacuzzi on the top floor it is very very filthy. If you want to be sick next day .. try your luck :) Tip 2: Go for the nearby Holiday Inn or the Miramar! Guaranteed a much much better deal

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Mupple
Reviews.Content: Checked in with a large group and it was chaos, took ages to sort out. Would have thought they would have been better organised. Rooms were tired and bit worn. Walls pretty thin and noises from adjoining rooms, TV on or not etc carried through. Does have a nice location on river, which means can walk to the attractions of Boat and Clarke Quay in 10-15 mins. But in my opinion, location in Singapore, unless you want to walk everywhere or need a great view can sometimes be overrated, given the great and well-priced transport available. Service was patchy, staff came across as disinterested and not particularly friendly. It wasn't bad, but with economy as it is, average service and tired rooms make the difference between choosing between one place or another. Next time, would probably go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: vkhoria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location, just next to the River. The view from the hotel is also good. The value for money is also great there. The cost is quite good. The service is also decent and the staff were quite courteous. The room was also good. Just felt that the rooms were small, but I guess most of the hotels in Singapore are like that, since land is scarce and is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Country”
Reviews.Author: nupurDehradun
Reviews.Content: We were on a two days visit to Singapore and our travel agent suggested us Hotel Riverview for the stay and got our room reserved for 27thth & 28th Dec. 2009. On our arrival, a warm reception was given to us at the hotel and our luggage was promptly shifted to our room. The room was quite good and well carpeted & furnished with all the best quality fixtures/ facilities to our comfort. The house keeping was perfect as no traces of dirt etc could be noticed during our stay. Later we could know that this hotel is among the visitor’s choicest hotels of Singapore and is 21 storied with more than 400 rooms (470 to be specific). We were in the 10th floor and we could see the river, city from the window. It is situated close to all the important places for tourists, businesses holidaying, shopping malls etc. This hotel has all the facilities for a conference, meetings, and banquets supported with all the modern systems. A swimming pool is in service on 5th floor with superb aesthetic environment. Complementary breakfast had all the things you could think for a healthy & tasty breakfast. The menu in hotel restaurant was enormous, preparations were good and service excellent. We can say that it is one of the best hotels of Singapore with all the luxury in rooms, best hospitality, good menu, preparations & service. We had an excellent stay at this hotel and recommend our friends/ relatives for this hotel. Suman Prakash

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: JetSet79
Reviews.Content: The best part about the hotel is its location. Its bang on the river, walking distance from Clarke Quay. The staff is really helpful and friendly. The hotel rooms are not too big, but clean and have nice views, even if you are not in a room towards the river side. Its excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, no fuss, no high expectations (just keep an eye on hotel card key)”
Reviews.Author: kkua
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a late check-in (past 1am) and was promptly checked-in. The next day, we left a room card key in the slot so we can leave the air-conditioning and electricity running while we were out exploring... big mistake. By the time we came back around cocktail hour, we realized housekeeping confiscated the key, the room was warm and our electronic appliances (laptops, mobile phones, shaver and toothbrush) were not charged. Beyond that snafu, everything feels like a generic westernized hotel (or an upscale Chinese hotel). The location was OK, but wish there was a closer mass transit location... although it was definitely walking distance, just don't do it during high noon hours because of the heat. OBTW, at a rate of USD145 through DeltaVacations (formerly NWAWorldVacations), it was definitely not worth it. Definitely feels like a sub USD100 per night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sydneyadmiral
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel through the Singapore Stopover Holiday for which I was eligible as I was flying Singapore Airlines. I had used this subsidised service before and had chosen a hotel in the most expensive category previously. That had been a fantastic experience of luxury and pampering. However this time I chose Riverview which is in the second tier of pricing. There was a lot right with the hotel - friendly check in staff, and being able to check in at 08.30am instead of having to wait until 2.00pm without paying for an extra night was a huge bonus. The room was nice and I had a view of the river. So why did I come away less than satisfied? The ensuite, though clean, wasn't spotless - for example, the grime round the base of the taps (one of my pet hates), my booking entitled me to 50% discount from the a la carte menu but I was invariably charged full price and had to ask for the discount - I found this distasteful, despite Singapore no smoking laws (signs everywhere) there was evidence in the elevators and other no smoking areas that smoking was happening in these places; internet connection cost about $S27.00 for 24 hours and these ran from the time of log in, not connection hours as has been the case in most other hotels I have stayed in. I would recommend this hotel again for someone who wants a place to recover from jetlag and save a few dollars. However, for myself, I will be paying the difference next time and going top tier.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of tranquility in the city yet near all the sites .”
Reviews.Author: Natterjacked
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel ,perfect setting on the banks of the river, up stream .Handy for the Bum boats to Clarke`s quay etc. Staff very helpful, food great , pool welcome after a days sightseeing. Very good value booked with Singapore Airlines discount offer for hotel and food. Good spacious surroundings. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “~~ Nice Hotel to Stay ~~”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Yuean
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel with a tidy room and quite surroundings, situated at the shore of quite river flowing across Singapore. The staff is friendly & helpfull . This hotel provide Promotion Package for selected country. I strongly encourage the hotel to have this package everytime especially for Malaysian Passport holder. Hotel location is good too coz its closed to Chinatown & others shopping centre . I would strongly recommend this hotel if you travel to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: snappy1Adelaide
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks stay at the Riverview Hotel in singapore,and after reading the few reports that we found on it where a little worried as to what we may find! We flew Tiger air from Adelaide via perth to singapore which was ok,but arrived at like 3am local time so very tired and weary,on arrival check in was very speedy and smooth although the staff were very unfreindly and did not seem to speak a lot of english. We had requested 2 rooms interconnecting,which we did get they are reasonably sized and quiet standard hotel rooms the bathrooms are looking a little out of date but we did find everything clean well stocked and comfortable. We had breakfasts included and the food was abundant and varied including western foods,chinese and other asian stlyes.We used the pool and gym area quiet a few times very nice,it is located on floor 5 so has a great view over the river and buildings. The hotel has a Japanese restuarant ,Chinese the buffett area and bar area we eat in all the Japanese was our favorite,all great food and not to high priced. The location we found was perfect for us,we walked to china town(very hot) but doable,hotel has free shuttle bus to orchard road-best shopping area. Everywhere else we caught taxis which are cheap and always at the door,we found this a much cheaper option for the 4 of us than booking with tour companies. we thought maybe a week in singapore would be too long as most only still use it as a stopover but be had a ball,our 2 children aged 12,16 that travelled with us found it interesting,and enjoyed there time as well my daughter especially enjoyed a elephant ride and the Night Safari a must do! The Riverviews location is right on the river allowing for great strolls along its banks,we caught a bumboat several times(a smallish wooden boat)to clark quay this was both a wonderful relaxing mode of transport and informative as they give a commentary as you travel. Overall well priced good location hotel,seeminly caters for mostly indians and asian travelers,we were the only westerners there the entire 7 days. singapore is a interesting thriving city. Would we stay here again probably yes would we visit singapore again definatly yes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View of Singapore City”
Reviews.Author: Mayur_M
Reviews.Content: Was in Singapore a couple of years back and stayed at the River View Singapore. To be frank I am a budget conscious traveller and always looking out for bargain offers and was therefore a bit skeptical of staying here after reading the reviews on the net. But my travel agent got a great bargain for me. The hotel is enormous (its a 20+ storey building) located right on the banks of Singapore River. The Rooms and other faciites are top notch. The breakfast was complimentary and it was quite fullsome consisting of continental and local cusines. As we were out on city tours during the day, we could not have lunch and dinner at the Restaurant. The pool was a bit small but very clean and well maintained. The attendants were on their toes to help you. The Gym and Jacuzzi were excellent. The hotel is also not very far from local attractions such as Orchard Road, Little India etc.

Reviews.Title: “An Eco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kunalhasija
Reviews.Content: the stay with the hotel was quite normal and the rooms are quite small as i was on 12 th floor and they do not provide free access to internet and the swiming pool was not so great ....

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: anusuyajohn
Reviews.Content: The hotel gives you a 4 star experience worthy of the cost! The rooms are spacious and luxurious as are the bathrooms. The restaurant is cosy and offers an excellent buffet spread for breakfast. The hotel spa is worth a visit and the freebies offered tempt you to spend half your time there! The locations is another great selling factor of this hotel. Away from the noise of Orachard Street and yet close enough to all the hot-spots of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Skyelander174
Reviews.Content: Having been delayed in leaving Singapore I needed a hotel quickish. I walked in off the street to be greeted by friendly reception staff who confirmed they could provide a room for the next 3 nights. The room had been refurbished recently and was spotless. Room service was brilliant and very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “what you should know before you book the hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: cloudy06
Reviews.Content: I recommend by my friends that reverview is a good hotel and they are member of the hotel and can book for me on special rates. I did do a research about this hotel before i booked for it and its pretty good and the hotel come with alot of facilities. But the things that makes me dissappointed is the room size is totally different from the photo that i saw at the internet. The bed is hard and the internet is chargeable. How can it be chargeable even other hotels is free!! But one things that really makes me not pretty happy is the way they exchange the foreign currency. They change the money without giving me the official exchange receipt! How can it be if the hotel running the currency exchange business without giving the receipt. Even just change a small amount but is it fair to the guest?? For me i absolutely wont book or recommend to my other friends that they would like to find book in riverview even given a special rates.

Reviews.Title: “Started bad but got better...”
Reviews.Author: NZ_Denz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a SSH (Singapore airlines Stopover Holiday). At first we got in tired and hot... we were travelling with 5 people and requested non smoking, interconnecting rooms. We were told they had no interconnecting rooms and they checked us in and saw us to our room... it STUNK!! They had put us on a smoking floor!!! And it was an interconnecting room!!! Did they lie??? Fuming we went back down to complain and they said they would upgrade us to a deluxe room, we requested to view it before accepting it. It was exactly the same as what we had, just not interconnecting and on the non smoking floor...?? Upgrade my [-]!!! But we took it cause we could not sleep on the smoking floor! They said they would do something for us tomorrow (yyssw, nothing happened). So we got to our new rooms and unpacked. The bathrooms needed a blooming good clean, they looked dirty, i unwrapped a glass and it had fingerprints all over it and did not look clean at all! The kicker was the beds were hard, but I was soo tired I did not care at this stage. Definately the worst hotel of my holiday. The best thing of this hotel is the restaurant. We had great food, all presented well. Fast service. It was the saving grace of our stay here! A-le-carte is 50% off on SSH too, which was excellent. Taxis waiting at the door are cheap to go anywhere too. Loved singapore, just not from this hotel... maybe I was expecting more...??? The next day I was not so tired and not so critical... but I would still not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Value for money”
Reviews.Author: GCfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the River View Hotel in Singapore for 3 nights on a stopover to Europe from Australia. We paid $498 AUD for the 3 nights. We were travelling with our 2 year old son and they didn't charge for him. We had 2 King Single beds pushed together, which gave us enough room for the 3 of us to sleep together for the 3 nights. (Not everone's cup of tea, but for a few nights, it's didn't bother us) We were on the 10th floor and had a lovely view up the River. The room was clean, modern, with a flat screen TV and a good size by Singaporean standards. It looks like the room had been newly refurbished. There was a good shower (always an essential after a long flight) There was a safe in the room, a small fridge & kettle, but strangely no coffee, tea, sugar or milk!!! We had the hot buffet breakfast the first morning at $25 SGD each. There were both Asian and Western style foods available and lots of staff on hand to assist. We were the only Western people in the room. I believe they normally have the breakfasts downstairs in a room overlooking the River, but this was being refurbished whilst we were there, so we were in a closed-in function room on the third floor. The Coffee shop downstairs was also being re-furbished, but it would have been lovely overlooking the River. On our two free days in Singapore we used the Taxi's because they are cheap, convenient with a young one and you could catch it right out the front of the hotel. We went to Sentosa Island one day and it cost us $7 SGD to Mt Faber, where we caught the cable car over to the island. On the second day, we went to Singapore Zoo and it cost $15 SGD by taxi. The Hotel has a free shuttle bus to take you to Orchard Rd for shopping. Not sure how convenient the Hotel is to MRT, as we chose to use Taxi's for our short stay, but you could always catch the shuttle bus to Orchard Rd and then catch the MRT from there. All in all we would stay here again, as we found it value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Riverview Hotel, Havelock Road”
Reviews.Author: hemarwai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverview hotel for a couple of nights to break our journey to New Zealand. It is on the river, with pleasant walks along the banks in both directions. We had booked a triple room which was a twin with an extra bed for our son, and the room was large, well furnished, and on the 6th floor, with views over a small park rather than the river. The staff were mainly Chinese, helpful and friendly, and we all enjoyed the dinner in the garden restaurant which offered a choice of Malaysian, Chinese and Indonesian food. There were two or three more restaurants on other floors. Breakfasts were hot and cold buffet style and had both western and chinese dishes. There was a notice in the room to tell the guest about impromptu fumigations, but obviously there had not been one for a few days or they had missed the live cockroach which our son found in a towel on our second day. This was slightly off-putting especially as it had not been cleared away when we returned at a later stage. As the metro was a good walk away, and we only had two days in which to see everything, we opted to take taxis everywhere. These are cheap and plentiful, and have chatty informative drivers. We enjoyed the hotel's swimming pool which was several floors up, so you got a view of the skyscrapers whilst swimming. There was also a gym but we didn't use it. We paid £84 per night for a triple room, and it was good value, but would opt to stay somewhere closer to a metro next time.

Reviews.Title: “What you should know before you book”
Reviews.Author: pinkpaul
Reviews.Content: I booked the Riverview hotel by chance. I had been several times to Singapore before and had some remembering on the fassade of a hotel, which I believed was this hotel (in fact it wasn't). As compared to the other hotels where I already was staying during my Singapore visits this hotel cannot match with them. It already starts with Internet booking. I did get no confirmation or reply on my Internet booking done on the hotel's Internet booking page, despite the form was properly filled in and sent out without any error message. After some days I called them and they told me, that there was no Internet booking visible to them (???). The standard double room is quite small. Arriving late in the night I had to see that the linen in the bed had three brownish nodes, which seemed to have "survived" washing. If you want to go into Internet with the wireless keyboard on the TV-screen, they charge you full! You also cannot download from Internet or watch TV at the same time. When going to breakfast I was negatively surprised, since it turned out that you are charged separately for it. The breakfast buffet is not worth the price (46 SGD for 2 persons). It is quite small and e.g. the corned beef was like coming freshly out of the can. The servants seem not to be really happy with their work. Moreover you are feeling that they are watching you with suspicion, fearing you would take something from e.g. American breakfast when you just were paying for European breakfast. The last day I got the coffee served to the table. Unfortunately the coffee was already cold until the rolls and the as-cold toast were served (they did not allow me to serve myself?). Another (negative) surprise came on payment. I assumed during Internet booking that the shown room price was all-inclusive. But in fact a service-charge is extra added (10% of room) along with some other fees (room CESS and room GST) and finally the ordinary tax (GST). Good in this hotel is that you can let your luggage in the hotel after check-out for later pick-up. Johann

Reviews.Title: “river view hotel”
Reviews.Author: wquick
Reviews.Content: We did have reasonable expectations of good service prior to checking in to the River View Hotel in Singapore and were disappointed to say the least. The reception staff we encountered on numerous occasions had a very poor understanding of the English language which made simple transactions hard. The room looked recently refurbished with incredibly hard mattresses and if you are tallish i.e. 183cm expect your feet to hang over the edge, like mine!! The relatively new television didn’t work from day one and we couldn’t bear having to explain our predicament to the reception staff, no one seemed to have a smile on there face or the ability to say good morning or good night, overall an experience we will not repeat.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: English - have been living in Australia
Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel but service lets it down”
Reviews.Author: MADTEAM
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a bit out of town so if you are on foot plan an extra half hour each day to go and come back. Hotel itself was nice. Some staff were very professional but unfortunately we felt that our older Asian counterparts staying in the hotel received a better service than we had. Rooms were clean and nice. Bathroom showing early signs of needing updating. When we arrived they had only a twin room instead of a double but said they'd change it for us the next day. They did change the room but it took a couple of attempts and some pretty unwilling looks before it happened. There was also confusion over whether breakfast was or wasn't included and they were quite rude. Breakfast it would appear was not included. Would not choose to stay there again as service did not match the price/star grading of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great base for Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: dunedinite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riverview for 6 nights in June this year. We found it a great base to explore Singapore from, especially since the SIA hop on hop off bus stop was just across the road. It was an easy walk along the river path to Clarkes Quay restaurants and bars, and a large supermarket and shopping mall. The roof top swimming pool was very welcome, and it was a quieter location than the hectic area around Orchard road. We also had a lovely view. The only down side was the room size, rather to small for the extra bed we had booked for our daughter, quite big enough for two however. We did make a fuss about this, and were given a newly decorated rooom in compensation. The whole hotel is being upgraded, the original rooms are ok but a bit faded. Dunedinite

Reviews.Title: “Under Renovation”
Reviews.Author: jancowan
Reviews.Content: The double room we were allocated was small. The air conditioning didn't work and had to be repaired. In the June heat, it is not an easy walk to anywhere and getting a taxi was quite difficult. We were not "eligible" to have breakfast (staff's words) so cannot comment on breakfast. The hotel is under renovation, so it could improve later.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreasForever
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 10 June 2005. Booked standard rooms but given a deluxe room. This is truly a good 3 star hotel. The room is spacious, clean and comfortable. Bathroom is also clean. Although its location is not near MRT, there is bus shelter in front of the hotel and also opposite the hotel there is bus shelter which is passed by C2 tourist bus (which I used a lot) considered tourist bus stops near shopping centres without additional walk such as MRT (MRT station to shopping centres). Breakfast is also good for its class. Swimming pool is small but it is standard for 3 star hotel while gym is a joke. Definitely will stay at the River View hotel again.
